lead_paragraph: With President Obama’s time in the White House almost up, a tour of Honolulu found residents proud of their native son but wistful about the coming loss of attention.

headline.print_headline: As the Obama Era Wanes, a Hometown Grows Wistful
headline.main: Hawaii Looks Back, and Ahead, as Its Presidential Spotlight Dims

snippet: With President Obama’s time in the White House almost up, a tour of Honolulu found residents proud of their native son but wistful about the coming loss of attention....
abstract: On the Ground column; residents of Honolulu reflect on experience of having had native son in White House for eight years; many note  end of Pres Obama's tenure will also mark end to golden age of representation for Hawaii in Washington, in light of Obama exiting office and death of influential Sen Daniel k Inouye in 2012.
